hotspots.label: Pantograph Arm
hotspots.fact: This curved metal arm on top of the train connects to overhead electrical wires to power the vehicle. It slides along the wires as the train moves, collecting electricity that makes the train go!

hotspots.label: Aerodynamic Design
hotspots.fact: The smooth, curved front of this light rail train is designed to cut through air efficiently. This streamlined shape reduces wind resistance and helps the train move faster while using less energy.

hotspots.label: Steel Wheels and Rails
hotspots.fact: Metal wheels rolling on steel rails create very little friction compared to rubber tires on roads. This means electric trains can move passengers very efficiently with less energy waste!

hotspots.label: Traction System
hotspots.fact: Electric motors in this train convert electrical power into motion that turns the wheels. Modern light rail trains like this one are much quieter and cleaner than buses or cars!
